title: Isaiah Chapter 44 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Isaiah chapter 44 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Isaiah Chapter 44 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Isaiah Chapter 44.

questions.question: Who does the LORD address as His servant in Isaiah 44:1?
options: Jacob
David
Moses
Abraham
questions.correctAnswer: Jacob
questions.explanation: Isaiah 44:1 specifically states, 'Yet now hear, O Jacob my servant; and Israel, whom I have chosen.'

questions.question: According to Isaiah 44:2, who formed Jacob from the womb?
options: The LORD
The angels
The prophets
The kings
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD
questions.explanation: Isaiah 44:2 says, 'Thus saith the LORD that made thee, and formed thee from the womb.'

questions.question: In Isaiah 44:3, what does God promise to pour upon him that is thirsty?
options: Water
Oil
Wine
Milk
questions.correctAnswer: Water
questions.explanation: Isaiah 44:3 states, 'For I will pour water upon him that is thirsty.'

questions.question: Isaiah 44:6 declares that God is the first and the ______.
options: last
strongest
highest
greatest
questions.correctAnswer: last
questions.explanation: Isaiah 44:6 says, 'I am the first, and I am the last; and beside me there is no God.'

questions.question: According to Isaiah 44:9, what is said about those who make graven images?
options: They are vanity
They are wise
They are blessed
They are strong
questions.correctAnswer: They are vanity
questions.explanation: Isaiah 44:9 states, 'They that make a graven image are all of them vanity.'

questions.question: What does the smith do in Isaiah 44:12?
options: Works with coals and hammers
Sings praises
Builds houses
Plants trees
questions.correctAnswer: Works with coals and hammers
questions.explanation: Isaiah 44:12 describes, 'The smith with the tongs both worketh in the coals, and fashioneth it with hammers.'

questions.question: True or False: According to Isaiah 44:16, the man roasts meat with part of the wood he has cut.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Isaiah 44:16 says, 'He burneth part thereof in the fire; with part thereof he eateth flesh; he roasteth roast.'

questions.question: What does the carpenter use to mark out the figure of a man in Isaiah 44:13?
options: A rule and compass
A sword and shield
A hammer and nails
A brush and paint
questions.correctAnswer: A rule and compass
questions.explanation: Isaiah 44:13 states, 'The carpenter stretcheth out his rule; he marketh it out with a line... and maketh it after the figure of a man.'

questions.question: Who is called the shepherd in Isaiah 44:28?
options: Cyrus
David
Solomon
Moses
questions.correctAnswer: Cyrus
questions.explanation: Isaiah 44:28 says, 'That saith of Cyrus, He is my shepherd.'

questions.question: True or False: Isaiah 44:8 says there is another God besides the LORD.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Isaiah 44:8 states, 'Is there a God beside me? yea, there is no God; I know not any.'

questions.question: According to Isaiah 44:22, how has God dealt with the transgressions of Israel?
options: Blotted them out as a thick cloud
Remembered them forever
Punished them severely
Ignored them
questions.correctAnswer: Blotted them out as a thick cloud
questions.explanation: Isaiah 44:22 says, 'I have blotted out, as a thick cloud, thy transgressions.'

questions.question: What does Isaiah 44:23 command the heavens and earth to do?
options: Sing and shout
Be silent
Shake and tremble
Weep and mourn
questions.correctAnswer: Sing and shout
questions.explanation: Isaiah 44:23 says, 'Sing, O ye heavens; for the LORD hath done it: shout, ye lower parts of the earth.'

questions.question: True or False: Isaiah 44:18 explains that people understand the folly of worshipping idols.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Isaiah 44:18 says, 'They have not known nor understood: for he hath shut their eyes.'

questions.question: Who does the LORD say He formed from the womb in Isaiah 44:24?
options: Israel
Egypt
Babylon
Assyria
questions.correctAnswer: Israel
questions.explanation: Isaiah 44:24 states, 'Thus saith the LORD, thy redeemer, and he that formed thee from the womb.'

questions.question: In Isaiah 44:20, what is said about the heart of the one who feeds on ashes?
options: It is a deceived heart
It is a joyful heart
It is a strong heart
It is a wise heart
questions.correctAnswer: It is a deceived heart
questions.explanation: Isaiah 44:20 says, 'He feedeth on ashes: a deceived heart hath turned him aside.'

medium.title: Isaiah Chapter 44 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Isaiah Chapter 44 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is feeling discouraged and fears they are forgotten by God. Based on Isaiah 44, what biblical truth would you share to encourage their faith and trust?
options: God has formed and chosen His people and will not forget them
They must work harder to earn God's favor
God is distant and does not care about individual struggles
They should rely solely on their own strength
questions.correctAnswer: God has formed and chosen His people and will not forget them
questions.explanation: Isaiah 44:1-2, 21 assure that God has formed Jacob and Israel and chosen them, promising never to forget them. This encourages trust and faith, not self-reliance or fear.

questions.question: How does Isaiah 44 teach us about the importance of spiritual blessing and growth in daily life?
options: God pours out His Spirit and blessing, causing His people to flourish like willows by water
Blessings are only for the wealthy and powerful
Spiritual growth depends solely on human effort
Material wealth is the sign of God's favor
questions.correctAnswer: God pours out His Spirit and blessing, causing His people to flourish like willows by water
questions.explanation: Isaiah 44:3-4 shows God's promise to pour out water and Spirit so His people will grow and flourish, illustrating the importance of trusting God's blessing for spiritual growth.

questions.question: A believer struggles with idolatry in their culture. According to Isaiah 44, what argument can be used to discourage idolatry and promote faithfulness to God?
options: Idols are powerless, made by human hands, and cannot help or save
Idols have great power and should be worshiped carefully
Idolatry is acceptable if it brings personal comfort
God supports multiple gods and idols
questions.correctAnswer: Idols are powerless, made by human hands, and cannot help or save
questions.explanation: Isaiah 44:9-20 emphasizes that idols are vain, made by men who are weak and hungry, and cannot see or save. This teaches believers to reject idolatry and trust in the one true God.

questions.question: What does Isaiah 44:6 teach us about the nature of God that can strengthen a believer's humility and contentment?
options: God is the first and last, unique with no other gods beside Him
God is one among many gods
God changes according to human desires
God is distant and unknown
questions.correctAnswer: God is the first and last, unique with no other gods beside Him
questions.explanation: Isaiah 44:6 declares God's uniqueness and eternal nature, reminding believers to humble themselves before the sovereign God and find contentment in His unmatched authority.

questions.question: In the context of prayer and personal devotion, what encouragement does Isaiah 44 give to those who fear and doubt God's presence?
options: Do not fear or be afraid; God has declared His presence and you are His witnesses
Fear is a sign that God has abandoned you
You must earn God's presence by perfect works
Prayer is unnecessary because God does not listen
questions.correctAnswer: Do not fear or be afraid; God has declared His presence and you are His witnesses
questions.explanation: Isaiah 44:8 encourages believers not to fear because God has declared His presence and made them His witnesses, affirming that prayer and trust in God are vital.

questions.question: How does Isaiah 44 illustrate the need for honesty and integrity in work, especially when crafting idols?
options: The idol makers are human and weak, working hard but their work is ultimately worthless
Idol makers are divine and their work is honored
Work should be done only for personal gain without concern for truth
Crafting idols is a noble and profitable profession
questions.correctAnswer: The idol makers are human and weak, working hard but their work is ultimately worthless
questions.explanation: Isaiah 44:11-12 describes the craftsmen as men who labor hard but produce useless idols, teaching that honest work aligned with God's purposes is valuable, but sinful work is futile.

questions.question: A Christian is tempted to worship material blessings instead of God. Based on Isaiah 44, what biblical insight would help resist this temptation?
options: Material things made by human hands are consumed and powerless; only God deserves worship
We should worship our possessions as gods
Material blessings are the only proof of God's favor
It is acceptable to pray to objects for help
questions.correctAnswer: Material things made by human hands are consumed and powerless; only God deserves worship
questions.explanation: Isaiah 44:15-17 explains how idols are made from wood that is burned and eaten, emphasizing that trusting in material things is foolish; only God is worthy of worship.

questions.question: What practical lesson about repentance and forgiveness can be drawn from Isaiah 44:22 for someone struggling with guilt?
options: God has blotted out sins like a thick cloud and invites to return and be redeemed
Guilt is permanent and cannot be removed
Only severe punishment can remove sin
Repentance is unnecessary because God ignores sin
questions.correctAnswer: God has blotted out sins like a thick cloud and invites to return and be redeemed
questions.explanation: Isaiah 44:22 assures that God forgives and redeems those who repent, encouraging believers to return to Him without fear of condemnation.

questions.question: True or False: According to Isaiah 44, God alone controls the future and fulfills His promises, including restoring cities and raising up decayed places.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Isaiah 44:26-27 states God confirms His servant's word and promises to rebuild Jerusalem and dry up rivers, showing His sovereign control over future events.

questions.question: True or False: Isaiah 44 teaches that God’s Spirit and blessing are only for the original Israelites and not for their descendants or future generations.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Isaiah 44:3 promises God will pour His Spirit and blessings upon the seed and offspring, indicating ongoing blessing for future generations.

questions.question: How does Isaiah 44 describe the foolishness of trusting in idols, and what spiritual discipline can believers practice to avoid this error?
options: Idols are made by humans who are weak and hungry; believers should trust and worship only the living God
Idols are powerful protectors; believers should pray to them regularly
Idols bring blessings through rituals; believers should follow all customs
Idols are neutral and can be ignored
questions.correctAnswer: Idols are made by humans who are weak and hungry; believers should trust and worship only the living God
questions.explanation: Isaiah 44:11-20 highlights the human weakness behind idols and their worthlessness, teaching believers to maintain spiritual discipline by worshiping God alone.

questions.question: A believer is struggling to forgive others. Based on Isaiah 44, what encouragement about God's forgiveness can you share to motivate them toward reconciliation?
options: God has blotted out our transgressions and redeemed us, so we should also forgive others
God never forgives sins and neither should we
Forgiveness is only for those who deserve it
Holding grudges is a sign of true faith
questions.correctAnswer: God has blotted out our transgressions and redeemed us, so we should also forgive others
questions.explanation: Isaiah 44:22 speaks of God's forgiveness and redemption, providing a model for believers to forgive and seek reconciliation.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Isaiah 44:28 says, 'That saith of Cyrus, He is my _______, and shall perform all my pleasure.'
options: shepherd
king
prophet
servant
questions.correctAnswer: shepherd
questions.explanation: Isaiah 44:28 identifies Cyrus as God's shepherd who will carry out His purposes, showing God's control over leaders and history.

questions.question: How does Isaiah 44 teach us about the importance of being witnesses for God in daily life and evangelism?
options: God declares His people as His witnesses who testify that He alone is God
Witnessing is optional and unnecessary
Evangelism is only for clergy, not lay believers
Silent faith is preferable to sharing the Gospel
questions.correctAnswer: God declares His people as His witnesses who testify that He alone is God
questions.explanation: Isaiah 44:8 calls God's people His witnesses, emphasizing the responsibility to proclaim His uniqueness and faithfulness in daily life.

questions.question: According to Isaiah 44, what can a believer learn about God’s power in relation to false prophets and diviners?
options: God frustrates the signs of liars and makes diviners mad, showing His supreme power over falsehood
False prophets have equal power with God
God supports diviners and their knowledge
False prophecy is more reliable than God’s word
questions.correctAnswer: God frustrates the signs of liars and makes diviners mad, showing His supreme power over falsehood
questions.explanation: Isaiah 44:25 reveals God's power to nullify false signs and confuse diviners, reinforcing trust in God’s truth over deception.

hard.title: Isaiah Chapter 44 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Isaiah Chapter 44.

questions.question: In Isaiah 44:6, the LORD declares, "I am the first, and I am the last; and beside me there is no God." How does this declaration reflect a literary device known as a chiasm?
options: It emphasizes God's eternal nature by placing 'first' and 'last' in a mirrored structure
It contrasts God with other gods using parallelism
It uses repetition to show God's omnipotence
It employs metaphor comparing God to a king
questions.correctAnswer: It emphasizes God's eternal nature by placing 'first' and 'last' in a mirrored structure
questions.explanation: Isaiah 44:6 uses a chiastic structure by stating 'I am the first, and I am the last,' which is a mirrored phrase emphasizing God's eternal and sovereign nature.

questions.question: Isaiah 44:3 uses the imagery of water being poured upon the thirsty and floods upon dry ground. What New Testament concept does this foreshadow?
options: The outpouring of the Holy Spirit
The baptism of believers
The flood during Noah's time
The parting of the Red Sea
questions.correctAnswer: The outpouring of the Holy Spirit
questions.explanation: The pouring of water and floods in Isaiah 44:3 metaphorically foreshadows the outpouring of the Holy Spirit upon believers, a theme seen in Acts 2.

questions.question: In Isaiah 44:9-20, the chapter critiques the making and worshiping of graven images. What cultural practice in the ancient Near East does this passage primarily address?
options: Idolatry and the crafting of idols from wood and metal
Animal sacrifices in pagan rituals
Polytheistic temple worship
Astrological divination
questions.correctAnswer: Idolatry and the crafting of idols from wood and metal
questions.explanation: Verses 9 to 20 describe the futility of crafting idols from wood and metal and worshiping them, directly addressing the idolatrous practices common in the ancient Near East.

questions.question: Isaiah 44:24 states that the LORD stretched forth the heavens alone. How does this relate to the creation narrative in Genesis 1?
options: It affirms God as the sole creator of the universe
It introduces a polytheistic view of creation
It denies God's involvement in creation
It suggests creation was a collaborative effort
questions.correctAnswer: It affirms God as the sole creator of the universe
questions.explanation: Isaiah 44:24 emphasizes God's singular creative power, aligning with Genesis 1 where God alone creates the heavens and the earth.

questions.question: Which historical figure mentioned in Isaiah 44:28 is described as God's shepherd, who will fulfill His purpose regarding Jerusalem and the temple?
options: Cyrus
Nebuchadnezzar
Darius
Artaxerxes
questions.correctAnswer: Cyrus
questions.explanation: Isaiah 44:28 explicitly names Cyrus as the LORD's shepherd who will accomplish His will by rebuilding Jerusalem and laying the temple's foundation.

questions.question: Isaiah 44:25 mentions God frustrating the tokens of liars and making diviners mad. What is the theological significance of this statement?
options: It highlights God's supremacy over false prophets and occult practices
It encourages people to trust diviners for guidance
It endorses the use of tokens in worship
It promotes divination as a way to know the future
questions.correctAnswer: It highlights God's supremacy over false prophets and occult practices
questions.explanation: The verse shows God's power to nullify false signs and confuse diviners, affirming His sovereignty over deceptive spiritual practices.

questions.question: True or False: Isaiah 44:21-22 uses the metaphor of a thick cloud to describe God's forgiveness of Israel's sins.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Isaiah 44:22 states, 'I have blotted out, as a thick cloud, thy transgressions,' using a cloud metaphor to symbolize the removal of sins.

questions.question: In Isaiah 44:13-16, the process of making an idol is described in detail. What literary technique is primarily used here?
options: Detailed narrative to show the absurdity of idol worship
Parable to teach a moral lesson
Allegory representing Israel's sin
Poetic parallelism emphasizing God's power
questions.correctAnswer: Detailed narrative to show the absurdity of idol worship
questions.explanation: The passage provides a step-by-step narrative of idol construction to emphasize the foolishness and futility of worshiping such man-made objects.

questions.question: How does Isaiah 44:5 demonstrate the theme of individual identity and belonging in Israel?
options: It shows people identifying themselves as belonging to the LORD and Israel
It describes a physical migration of tribes
It outlines laws for naming children
It records genealogies of Israel
questions.correctAnswer: It shows people identifying themselves as belonging to the LORD and Israel
questions.explanation: Verse 5 depicts individuals declaring their belonging to the LORD and adopting the names Jacob and Israel, symbolizing spiritual identity and covenantal relationship.

questions.question: Isaiah 44:7 questions, "Who, as I, shall call, and shall declare it, and set it in order for me?" What does this rhetorical question assert about God's role in history?
options: God alone ordains and reveals future events
God is unsure of future events
Humans can predict the future better than God
God depends on others to declare His plans
questions.correctAnswer: God alone ordains and reveals future events
questions.explanation: The rhetorical question in Isaiah 44:7 emphasizes God's unique authority to call, declare, and arrange history, highlighting divine sovereignty.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: According to Isaiah 44:18, those who make idols have had their eyes _____ and their hearts _____, so they cannot understand.
options: shut; closed
opened; enlightened
shut; closed
shut; blinded
questions.correctAnswer: shut; closed
questions.explanation: Isaiah 44:18 states that God has shut their eyes and closed their hearts so they cannot see or understand the folly of idolatry.

questions.question: Isaiah 44:27 commands the deep to be dry and rivers to be dried up. What historical event might this imagery foreshadow in the Old Testament narrative?
options: The parting of the Red Sea during the Exodus
The flooding during Noah's time
The draining of the Jordan River during Joshua's crossing
The destruction of the Canaanite cities
questions.correctAnswer: The parting of the Red Sea during the Exodus
questions.explanation: The command to dry rivers in Isaiah 44:27 echoes imagery of God's power in Exodus where the Red Sea was parted for Israel to cross.

questions.question: How does Isaiah 44:23 use nature imagery to express the theme of redemption?
options: Heavens, earth, mountains, forests, and trees are called to sing and rejoice
Animals are commanded to fast and pray
Rivers and seas are asked to bring judgment
Stars are said to fall from the sky in mourning
questions.correctAnswer: Heavens, earth, mountains, forests, and trees are called to sing and rejoice
questions.explanation: Verse 23 calls creation itself—heavens, earth, mountains, and trees—to rejoice in God's redemptive act for Israel, showing cosmic celebration.

questions.question: Isaiah 44:12 describes the smith working with tongs and hammers. What does this depiction reveal about the human condition in contrast to God’s creative power?
options: Humans labor and grow weak, unlike God's effortless creation
Humans are stronger than God
The smith’s work is eternal and divine
Humans do not need rest or sustenance
questions.correctAnswer: Humans labor and grow weak, unlike God's effortless creation
questions.explanation: Isaiah 44:12 highlights the smith’s physical weakness and hunger to contrast human frailty with God's omnipotent creative power.

questions.question: True or False: Isaiah 44:22 promises that Israel will be forgotten by God due to their sins.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Isaiah 44:21-22 assures that Israel, God's servant, will not be forgotten because God has redeemed them and blotted out their sins.

theological.title: Isaiah Chapter 44 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Isaiah Chapter 44 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Isaiah 44:6, how does God describe Himself in relation to other gods?
options: I am the first, and I am the last; and beside me there is no God
I am a jealous God who punishes idols
I am the God of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob
I am the God who made heaven and earth
questions.correctAnswer: I am the first, and I am the last; and beside me there is no God
questions.explanation: Isaiah 44:6 explicitly states God's uniqueness and eternal nature, affirming monotheism which is also echoed in Revelation 1:8, Deuteronomy 32:39, and Isaiah 41:4.

questions.question: What promise does God make about His Spirit and blessing in Isaiah 44:3?
options: I will pour my spirit upon thy seed, and my blessing upon thine offspring
I will send angels to protect you
I will give you riches and honor
I will remove all your enemies
questions.correctAnswer: I will pour my spirit upon thy seed, and my blessing upon thine offspring
questions.explanation: Isaiah 44:3 promises the outpouring of the Spirit and blessings on the descendants, which finds fulfillment in Joel 2:28-29 and is referenced in Acts 2 regarding the coming of the Holy Spirit.

questions.question: In Isaiah 44:22, what does God say He has done to the transgressions and sins of Israel?
options: I have blotted out, as a thick cloud, thy transgressions, and, as a cloud, thy sins
I have punished them with exile
I have recorded them in the book of remembrance
I have hidden them from the eyes of men
questions.correctAnswer: I have blotted out, as a thick cloud, thy transgressions, and, as a cloud, thy sins
questions.explanation: Isaiah 44:22 declares God's forgiveness by blotting out sins, consistent with Psalm 103:12, Micah 7:19, Hebrews 8:12, and 1 John 1:9, showing God's merciful nature.

questions.question: What is the significance of Cyrus according to Isaiah 44:28?
options: He is God's shepherd who will fulfill God's purposes
He is a false king who opposes God's people
He is a prophet sent to Israel
He is a priest who will rebuild the temple
questions.correctAnswer: He is God's shepherd who will fulfill God's purposes
questions.explanation: Isaiah 44:28 names Cyrus as God's appointed instrument to rebuild Jerusalem and the temple, highlighting God's sovereign control over history, as also affirmed in Ezra 1:1-4 and Daniel 6:25-27.

questions.question: What critique does Isaiah 44:9-20 offer regarding idolatry?
options: Idols are vanity and cannot see, know, or save
Idols are powerful gods that deserve worship
Idols are created by angels
Idols are helpful symbols of God
questions.correctAnswer: Idols are vanity and cannot see, know, or save
questions.explanation: Isaiah 44:9-20 condemns the making and worship of idols as futile and foolish, showing that idols are lifeless and deceptive, a theme echoed in Psalm 115:4-8, Jeremiah 10:5, Habakkuk 2:18-19, and 1 Corinthians 8:4-6.

questions.question: According to Isaiah 44:24, how does God describe His creative work?
options: I am the LORD that maketh all things; that stretcheth forth the heavens alone
I am the LORD who made the earth with many helpers
I am a god among many gods who create
I am the LORD who formed man from the dust
questions.correctAnswer: I am the LORD that maketh all things; that stretcheth forth the heavens alone
questions.explanation: Isaiah 44:24 emphasizes God's sole creative power, reflecting monotheism and God's sovereignty, consistent with Genesis 1:1, Nehemiah 9:6, Job 38:4-7, and John 1:3.

questions.question: What does Isaiah 44:7 claim God has the authority to do that no other can?
options: Call and declare the end from the beginning
Perform miracles to save the people
Judge the nations with justice
Renew the covenant with Israel
questions.correctAnswer: Call and declare the end from the beginning
questions.explanation: Isaiah 44:7 asserts God's unique authority to declare future events, showing His omniscience, a theme supported by Isaiah 46:9-10, Daniel 2:28, Psalm 139:4, and Revelation 1:8.

questions.question: How does Isaiah 44:25 describe God's action toward liars and diviners?
options: He frustrates their tokens and makes diviners mad
He blesses their craft and wisdom
He ignores their falsehoods
He punishes them with exile
questions.correctAnswer: He frustrates their tokens and makes diviners mad
questions.explanation: Isaiah 44:25 indicates God's power to confound false prophets and diviners, showing His control over deception, which aligns with Deuteronomy 18:10-12, 2 Kings 17:17, and Acts 13:10-11.

questions.question: What does Isaiah 44:5 say about the identity of God's people in relation to His name?
options: One shall say, I am the LORD'S; another shall call himself by the name of Jacob
They shall be known as the priests of the Most High
They shall be called the children of Abraham
They shall be known by the name of Zion
questions.correctAnswer: One shall say, I am the LORD'S; another shall call himself by the name of Jacob
questions.explanation: Isaiah 44:5 reveals the belonging and covenant identity of God's people as His own and bearing the names Jacob and Israel, which echoes Exodus 19:5-6 and Romans 9:6-8.

questions.question: In Isaiah 44:21, what does God remind Israel about their relationship to Him?
options: Thou art my servant: I have formed thee
Thou art a stranger to me
Thou hast forsaken my laws
Thou art chosen above all nations
questions.correctAnswer: Thou art my servant: I have formed thee
questions.explanation: Isaiah 44:21 emphasizes Israel as God's servant, highlighting divine election and formation, consistent with Exodus 4:22, Isaiah 41:8, Jeremiah 30:10, and Romans 11:1-2.

questions.question: According to Isaiah 44:26, what will God do for Jerusalem and the cities of Judah?
options: They shall be inhabited and built up; decayed places will be raised
They shall be destroyed because of sin
They shall be forgotten and abandoned
They shall become a wilderness
questions.correctAnswer: They shall be inhabited and built up; decayed places will be raised
questions.explanation: Isaiah 44:26 promises restoration of Jerusalem and Judah, a theme fulfilled in post-exilic books like Ezra and Nehemiah, and reflected in Jeremiah 31:38-40 and Zechariah 8:3.

questions.question: What does Isaiah 44:18 say about the spiritual condition of idolaters?
options: They have not known nor understood; their eyes and hearts are shut
They are enlightened and know the truth
They are protected by the idols
They are chosen by God
questions.correctAnswer: They have not known nor understood; their eyes and hearts are shut
questions.explanation: Isaiah 44:18 describes the blindness and hardness of heart of idolaters, highlighting spiritual ignorance, which corresponds with Romans 1:21-23, 2 Corinthians 4:4, and Ephesians 4:18.

questions.question: What is the consequence described in Isaiah 44:20 for one who worships a carved image made from the same wood he burns?
options: He feeds on ashes and is deceived
He gains wisdom and strength
He receives blessings from God
He becomes a priest of the true God
questions.correctAnswer: He feeds on ashes and is deceived
questions.explanation: Isaiah 44:20 depicts the absurdity and self-deception of idolatry, a motif reflected in Psalm 106:36-39, Jeremiah 2:27, and 1 Corinthians 10:20-21.

questions.question: Who does Isaiah 44:28 identify as the one who will lay the foundation of the temple in Jerusalem?
options: Cyrus
Nebuchadnezzar
Darius
Artaxerxes
questions.correctAnswer: Cyrus
questions.explanation: Isaiah 44:28 names Cyrus as the one who will lay the temple's foundation, demonstrating God's sovereign orchestration of history, supported by Ezra 1:1-4 and 2 Chronicles 36:22-23.

questions.question: According to Isaiah 44:4, how will God's blessing manifest among His people?
options: They shall spring up as willows by the water courses
They shall become mighty warriors
They shall build great cities
They shall be rulers over the nations
questions.correctAnswer: They shall spring up as willows by the water courses
questions.explanation: Isaiah 44:4 uses imagery of willows by water to symbolize vitality and flourishing by God's blessing, a metaphor also found in Psalm 1:3, Jeremiah 17:8, Ezekiel 47:12, and John 15:5.
